intro: Muscarella echinodes, commonly known as the spiny muscaria, is a rare and distinctive member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, waxy leaves that are often adorned with small, spiny protrusions along the margins. The plant produces large, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale green in color. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a valuable species in botanical collections.
